definition: east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half

sentences.english: Small catlike predatory mammals of warmer parts of the Old World.
sentences.chinese: 东半球温暖地区的象猫的小型食肉哺乳动物。

sentences.english: Any of various Old World freshwater fishes of the genus Barbus or Puntius and related genera.
sentences.chinese: 一种东半球鲃属或须鲃属及有关科属的淡水鱼类。

sentences.english: Old World ground-living cuckoo having a long dagger-like hind claw .
sentences.chinese: 东半球陆地生杜鹃，后爪长而似剑。

sentences.english: Native to tropical South America, peanuts were introduced early into the Old World tropics.
sentences.chinese: 花生原产南美热带，很早就传到东半球热带地区。

sentences.english: Old World warbler similar to the greater whitethroat but smaller.
sentences.chinese: 东半球与大白喉莺的鸟但体型较小。

sentences.english: Any of various small freshwater fishes of the family Cyprinidae, which also includes carps and minnows.
sentences.chinese: 一种东半球鲃属或须鲃属及有关科属的淡水鱼类。

sentences.english: Old World woodpecker with a peculiar habit of twisting the neck.
sentences.chinese: 东半球有特殊的扭脖子习惯的啄木鸟。

sentences.english: Old World alpine poppy with white or yellow to orange flowers.
sentences.chinese: 东半球一种山罂粟，开白或黄到橙黄色花。

definition: equator (of the earth or astronomical body)

pinyin: guo2 ji4 ri4 qi1 bian4 geng1 xian4
